metadata.synopsis: The player encounter Nightsong, an angelic Aasimar and daughter of Selune who has been trapped in the Shadowfell for a century, first to serve as fodder for Dark Justiciars to kill (they must kill a Selunite to ascend), and then to provide Ketheric with immortality through a soul cage. The player can meet her either alone or with Balthazar. Nightsong is defiant and full of rage. She is immortal, so her current trials are, for her, an annoyance, an indignity, but she knows she will ultimately have her revenge. She regards the player with haughty defiance until she is convinced the player is on her side. If she's freed, she'll have 2 big cinematics of becoming free and cleansed by Selune.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Approach Nightsong at -712; -142; -1427 when Balthazar is dead

24.speaker: Nightsong
24.text: A valiant performance. I admit, my heart lit like a full moon when you struck down that cadaver.
24.context: NodeContext: Trying to figure the player out. A hint of hope in her voice, but with an edge - she does not trust easily.

94.speaker: Nightsong
94.text: But why betray your kinsman? Why turn your ire on he who sent you here? Go on, Sharran - speak.
94.context: NodeContext: Trying to figure the player out. A hint of hope in her voice, but with an edge - she does not trust easily.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Balthazar didn't send me here - I came of my own accord.
42.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

62.speaker: Nightsong
62.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I have questions for you, first.
80.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

43.speaker: Nightsong
43.text: And I have naught but time.
43.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

156.speaker: Player
156.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

59.speaker: Nightsong
59.text: I am Dame Aylin. Out of this hellish realm I carry my sword by the blessing of my mother, Selûne.

178.speaker: Player
178.text: How long have you been trapped here?
178.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

114.speaker: Nightsong
114.text: A hundred years. More, perhaps. Concocted by Ketheric, enacted by Balthazar, my misery has been my centuries' long companion.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: I must decide what to do with you.
108.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

113.speaker: Nightsong
113.text: HAH! By all means, Sharran. Decide.
113.context: NodeContext: Haughty. She may be trapped, but she in no way feels her fate is in the player's hands.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: I thought the 'Nightsong' was some relic. When I realised you were a person, I couldn't justify helping Balthazar.

22.speaker: Nightsong
22.text: A Sharran with a heart? No... perhaps you are no Sharran at all.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: Why do you call me Sharran?

155.speaker: Player
155.text: My kin are strong of arm and heart. The necromancer was neither.

52.speaker: Nightsong
52.text: A maxim simple and noble - too noble for a Sharran. Perhaps I named you false.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: I serve a god who walks the light. I am no Sharran.

83.speaker: Nightsong
83.text: This cursed place is far from our Lady's favour - why would you walk here?

131.speaker: Player
131.text: I get a bit obsessive about murder at times, but I'm no cultist! That's just rude.

147.speaker: Nightsong
147.text: A servant of the Dark Lady would never disavow her. Perhaps I named you false.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Some would call his experiments heretical - I simply thought them cruel. Unnecessary.

69.speaker: Nightsong
69.text: An intriguing fray. You lay low the Dark Lady's messenger - your ally, your friend. Perhaps you wish to slay the 'Nightsong' yourself, Sharran.
69.context: InternalNodeContext: This greeting if the player rejected SH's COM moment and ultimately killed her.

93.speaker: Nightsong
93.text: I have all the time in the world. How about you?

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Perhaps I can still kill you - I found a spear that seems intended for that very purpose.

119.speaker: Nightsong
119.text: Run your coop all you like, chicken. You cannot fly without my wings.

134.speaker: Nightsong
134.text: Come for more blood, you dog?
134.context: NodeContext: Complete bitterness; the player has killed her once already

150.speaker: Nightsong
150.text: Was it everything you hoped for? Was it sweet, Sharran, to murder a paladin of Selûne - her daughter - her sword?
150.context: CinematicNodeContext: This is Nightson'gs first node after the player has killed her in combat, and then she's risen again. She should be a little worse for wear here, having just resurrected. Perhaps glowering at the player, breathing heavily for the first node or so.InternalNodeContext: The player 'killed' Nightsong. She has stood up again, immortal.NodeContext: Bitter sarcasm in her voice. She thinks the player is the lowest of the low - a violent idiot. Obviously injured, breathing heavily.

105.speaker: Nightsong
105.text: Congratulations - your mistress Shar will write your name on her hand.
105.context: NodeContext: Bitter sarcasm in her voice. She thinks the player is the lowest of the low - a violent idiot. Injured, but regaining strength.

86.speaker: Nightsong
86.text: And I? I will come for you. When the time is right. When your children are grown and your eyes are weak; when your nose grows as long as your weary, weary days...
86.context: NodeContext: A cold threat. Not yet at full strength, but you wouldn't tell by her tone.

31.speaker: Nightsong
31.text: That is when this immortal will visit you, Sharran. That is when I will show you what it is to be afraid.
31.context: CinematicNodeContext: She steps forward in anger; on 'What it is to be afraid' she overdoes it and the hands appear again, seizing her and pulling her back. They fade as her line fades and she steps back into place.NodeContext: Fully recovered now.

152.speaker: Player
152.text: Why do you call me Sharran?
152.context: NodeContext: Does not believe the player is here to help her. Huge, bitter laugh on the 'HAH!' Head thrown back, perhaps.

179.speaker: Nightsong
179.text: Do not play games with me, Sharran. You have come to earn your title; to become what your queen has promised. One of her chosen murderers.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Forgive me. I should not have harmed you.
164.context: NodeContext: Does not believe the player is here to help her. Huge, bitter laugh on the 'HAH!' Head thrown back, perhaps.

158.speaker: Nightsong
158.text: HAH! Are you afraid, Sharran? Do you rattle and jump at the realisation that an immortal has your face emblazoned in her mind forevermore?
158.context: NodeContext: Does not believe the player is here to help her. Huge, bitter laugh on the 'HAH!' Head thrown back, perhaps.

162.speaker: Player
162.text: I'm not afraid of you - now or ever.
162.context: NodeContext: She grimaces at you, then snorts a huge loogie and spits it on the ground, then turns away.

81.speaker: Nightsong
81.text: Good. Foolish prey makes for easy finding.
81.context: NodeContext: She grimaces at you, then snorts a huge loogie and spits it on the ground, then turns away.

132.speaker: Nightsong
132.text: Run along now. Go tell your darling master Ketheric what a good child you've been.
132.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: I do not serve Ketheric. I've come to make him vulnerable.

187.speaker: Nightsong
187.text: A bloodsporter, then. No Sharran, but a killer without cause. Fie! What sickness plagues Faerûn.

66.speaker: Nightsong
66.text: But perhaps... an inoculation, to make the sickness less catching. If you seek to harm Ketheric, our aims are aligned. If you seek to make him vulnerable, your task is done.

166.speaker: Player
166.text: You say you're immortal. How is that so?

55.speaker: Nightsong
55.text: Shar herself could not dim her face. And you will never dim mine.

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I am not one of Shar's servants.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: I'm no Sharran. I'm something far worse.

161.speaker: Nightsong
161.text: I have felt you coming. The first in a century.
161.context: CinematicNodeContext: She paces the narrow cage where she's kept, like a tiger. She looks down as she paces, not yet deigning to make eye contact.

177.speaker: Nightsong
177.text: You, who have come to drive a dagger through my heart.
177.context: CinematicNodeContext: She continues pacing, watching her feet, but slams her open palm against her heart.

44.speaker: Nightsong
44.text: You, who seek to claim the ultimate prize.
44.context: CinematicNodeContext: She looks up and sneers, gesticulating powerfully with her arms

98.speaker: Nightsong
98.text: Present your weapon, soldier. Plunge it into the Nightsong. I cannot stop you. But know this:
98.context: CinematicNodeContext: On "Present your weapon, soldier," She abruptly turns to the player and points an accusing finger. As she moves and points she steps forward. Magical hands appear around her wrists, arms, and shoulders, showing the player how she is bound. If she moves too far, she'll be pulled back by her arms. She looks down at the hands and grimaces in rage, stepping back into place as the hands fade: "Plunge it into the Nightsong. I cannot stop you. But know this. Slams chest again, fury in her movements.

13.speaker: Nightsong
13.context: CinematicNodeContext: Stock still. Cold. Staring the player dead in the eyes.NodeContext: With a deep, seething foreboding

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *The Spear of Night could be meant to sacrifice the Nightsong - but are you the one supposed to wield it?*
29.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player produces the spear of night and looks at it.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: You're the Nightsong. A person. Not a relic.
116.context: NodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

57.speaker: Nightsong
57.text: Shar kept you ignorant, did she? Or was it Ketheric? Perhaps they forgot to tell you they'd make a murderer of you yet.
57.context: NodeContext: A mirthless humor in her voice

2.speaker: Nightsong
2.text: Come - now is not the time for a crisis of faith. Go on. Kill me. You won't be the first.
2.context: NodeContext: Like a parent chastising a naughty child.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: How many times have you given that speech?
136.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

12.speaker: Nightsong
12.text: How many of your Dark Justiciar brethren have run my heart through? How many times have I, immortal, risen again, to await the next?
12.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

141.speaker: Nightsong
141.text: Do what you came to do, Sharran. Then run to your darling master Ketheric and tell him what a good child you've been.
141.context: NodeContext: With aggression re: Ketheric. It's clear she's invting Ketheric down here so she can destroy him.

176.speaker: Player
176.context: NodeContext: With a steely edge, bracing herself for what she believes is coming - the sword through her heart.

36.speaker: Nightsong
36.text: To eat his sins. Shall I take yours too?
36.context: NodeContext: With a steely edge, bracing herself for what she believes is coming - the sword through her heart.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: I'm here to help you - not harm you.

170.speaker: Nightsong
170.text: Those are words I've never heard - not since I've been in this dark dungeon.

91.speaker: Nightsong
91.context: NodeContext: Dubious but wants to hear more, afraid to believe you're really going to help

148.speaker: Player
148.text: I've come to find the source of Ketheric's invulnerability - and end it.
148.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

49.speaker: Nightsong
49.text: Then your task is done. Lay a hand upon me in camaraderie, and I will be free.
49.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

101.speaker: Player
101.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

17.speaker: Nightsong
17.text: That and nothing more. So certain was Balthazar that I had no friends in this place. Oh, how he taunted and cajoled.

174.speaker: Nightsong
174.text: But if you are a friend - you can be my salvation.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Not so fast. What's to stop you from turning on me once you're free?
180.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

97.speaker: Nightsong
97.text: Ha! A century have I been confined here - and I would spend a century more in devoted gratitude to they who set me free.
97.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

53.speaker: Nightsong
53.text: Even one who had crossed a terrible threshold just prior; even one who had driven me to death.
53.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that the player killed her.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: What will happen when I do?
37.context: NodeContext: Bravado melts for a moment. She really is desperate to get out of here, and oyu are her best bet.

172.speaker: Nightsong
172.text: I will be freed from these shackles. Ketheric will be made mortal. And then? Lo! Then, I will run him through until he's dead.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: How are you the source of Ketheric's invulnerability?
27.context: NodeContext: Bravado melts for a moment. She really is desperate to get out of here, and oyu are her best bet.

109.speaker: Nightsong
109.text: This cage links us, like a parasite's fangs to its host. I am immortal; while I am trapped here, so is he.

139.speaker: Nightsong
139.text: Free me, and Ketheric will bleed.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: No - you'll stay where you are.
8.context: NodeContext: Bravado melts for a moment. She really is desperate to get out of here, and oyu are her best bet.

84.speaker: Nightsong
84.context: NodeContext: Bravado melts for a moment. She really is desperate to get out of here, and oyu are her best bet.

104.speaker: Nightsong
104.text: A century I have known naught but sorrow; rage. A century have I been Ketheric's captive.
104.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

40.speaker: Nightsong
40.text: A century have I been subject to endless death - at hands so like your own.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

4.speaker: Nightsong
4.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

140.speaker: Player
140.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

175.speaker: Nightsong
175.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong kneels, and the player lays a hand on Nightsong's shoulderNodeContext: She is soon to be released. She is grateful, glad.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: How much is your freedom worth to you?

138.speaker: Nightsong
138.text: A promise - the most sacred I can give. Release me and I will kill Ketheric Thorm.

33.speaker: Nightsong
33.text: I showed you my heart; now use your head, young warrior. How will you fly this place without my helping hand?

159.speaker: Nightsong
159.text: When you have exhausted yourself with foolishness, you will release me. Go on: see.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: Maybe it would be safer to just kill you. I found a spear in this place that seems perfect for the task.

183.speaker: Nightsong
183.text: The Spear of Night. You are not the Nightsinger's chosen champion - her weapon is useless in your hands.

63.speaker: Nightsong
63.text: Keep it, if you wish. It is nothing but a bauble now. Just free me.

151.speaker: Player
151.text: That's all? No abjurations or charms to unweave? All you need is a hand?

26.speaker: Nightsong
26.text: To think I nearly thought my anguish done. To think I nigh believed you weren't one of Shar's footmen.

10.speaker: Nightsong
10.text: Know I will feel every wound, and still I will hurt less than you, who so utterly yourself defile.

144.speaker: Player
144.text: I didn't realise you were a person - not a relic. Let's get you out of here.
144.context: NodeContext: Spelling it out for the player- hell no.

163.speaker: Nightsong
163.text: Didn't you, when you murdered me? Perhaps you were stricken blind by foolish devotion.

149.speaker: Nightsong
149.text: Go on, then. Lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

185.speaker: Player
185.text: Ketheric has sent me to retrieve you.
185.context: NodeContext: Spelling it out for the player- hell no.

35.speaker: Nightsong
35.text: I cannot prevent you. But I can advise you. Be careful to whom you yoke your fate.
35.context: NodeContext: Spelling it out for the player- hell no.

184.speaker: Nightsong
184.text: One day, when he is severed from me, Ketheric will die. I will not. And when I am freed, I will remember whose recompense to claim.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I am no Sharran. I've come to free you.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: What happens if I do as you say - plunge my weapon into your heart?
115.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

96.speaker: Nightsong
96.text: You will have done what your Dark Lady requires - you will have slain a child of Selûne. You will be a Dark Justiciar. Isn't it so?

110.speaker: Nightsong
110.text: And I - hah - I will die. Then live. And when the next of your ilk comes with sword aloft or arrow nocked, I'll die again.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: It almost seems like you want me to attack you.
135.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

146.speaker: Nightsong
146.text: Did you expect me to beg? To cry? To plead? For what.

47.speaker: Nightsong
47.text: I accept my fate - for now. But the life of a divine is longer than you can fathom, Sharran. And this cold chapter will close, one day.

45.speaker: Player
45.text: You say you're immortal - how is that so?
45.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

5.speaker: Nightsong
5.text: I'm sure you've met my mother. You've seen her pale face in the night sky - Selûne, the Moonmaiden.

153.speaker: Nightsong
153.text: There is no moon in this black sky, Sharran - no. There is only your mistress - the void of her. The shadow.

51.speaker: Player
51.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

145.speaker: Nightsong
145.text: No? Then correct me. By all means, little warrior, explain yourself.
145.context: NodeContext: A demand, not a question.

67.speaker: Player
67.text: I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. I need to kill Ketheric Thorm.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: I'm a friend. Let me free you.

129.speaker: Nightsong
129.text: Then lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'm someone who can recognise a good opportunity.

21.speaker: Nightsong
21.text: Your eyes are keen. Free me. You will enjoy what comes next.

111.speaker: Nightsong
111.text: Go on. Lay a hand upon my shoulder, and I shall be free.

124.speaker: Player
124.text: I will kill you for pleasure, not Lady Shar.

186.speaker: Player
186.text: To kill an immortal: what perfect irony. I think I will.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Kill you? I found a spear that seems intended for that very purpose.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: It would be a delight to grant your desired death, my lady.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Do as she says: kill her.
